definition: to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited

sentences.english: This is the second time Requena has been dismissed from IDEA.
Earlier this year the railways minister was sacked on suspicion of vast corruption.
sentences.chinese: 今年初，鐵路部長因涉嫌鉅額貪污而被免職。

sentences.english: He is said to have already been removed from office.
Multilingual indexing with stop words removal.
sentences.chinese: 多語種索引與停止的話免職。

sentences.english: Several attorneys-general were fired by the president.
sentences.chinese: 幾位首席檢察官被總統免職。

sentences.english: If he persists, let him be deposed, as having murdered his brother.
sentences.chinese: 若他堅持這樣，就應將他免職，因他謀殺自己的弟兄。

sentences.english: The official was dismissed from office for taking bribes.
More than 90 officers and airmen were eventually relieved or reassigned.
sentences.chinese: 最後有90多名軍官和飛行員被免職或重新委派工作。

sentences.english: The members who had voted against the court were dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 曾投票反對宮廷者均遭免職。

sentences.english: You could even argue that Berlusconi's already been removed once over the economy.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可以說，貝盧斯科尼也是被經濟給免職了。

sentences.english: Officials sacked for deadly high-rise fire in Shanghai .
sentences.chinese: 上海靜安區多名官員因高樓大火案被免職。

sentences.english: C. This is the reason why he was dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 這就是張馨予被免職劉德華原因。

definition: to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to be transferred to another post/to post away
common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
Kanting township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
